In January 2020, Moore said in an interview with ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' that her sixth studio album was titled ''[[Silver Landings]]'' and would be released in early March, via [[Verve Forecast Records]]. She said regarding her decision to sign with Verve Forecast in late 2019, "I had slight [[Posttraumatic stress disorder|PTSD]] from being on labels in the past [...] but Verve truly feels like it's run by a bunch of deeply creative people who aren't necessarily just concerned with the numbers game".<ref>{{cite magazine|last=Weiner|first=Natalie|title=With Her First New Album In a Decade, Mandy Moore Is Finally Owning Her Voice|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/country/8547649/mandy-moore-new-album-silver-landings-interview|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|publisher=[[Eldridge Industries]]|location=United States|date=January 10, 2020|access-date=January 10, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200111012610/https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/country/8547649/mandy-moore-new-album-silver-landings-interview|archive-date=January 11, 2020|url-status=live}}</ref> Moore later announced a release date of March 6, and also released the single "Save a Little for Yourself" with an accompanying music video.<ref>{{cite news|last=Shaffer|first=Claire|title=Mandy Moore Announces First Album in 10 Years, 'Silver Landings'|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/mandy-moore-silver-landings-save-a-little-for-yourself-937301/|work=[[Rolling Stone (magazine)|Rolling Stone]]|date=January 14, 2020|access-date=January 14, 2020}}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine|last=Romano|first=Nick|title=Mandy Moore reveals first album in over 10 years with fresh song|url=https://ew.com/music/2020/01/14/mandy-moore-album-silver-landings/|magazine=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|date=January 14, 2020|access-date=January 14, 2020}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Peacock|first=Tim|title=Watch The Video For Mandy Moore's 'Save A Little For Yourself', From New Album, 'Silver Landings'|url=https://www.udiscovermusic.com/news/mandy-moore-silver-landings/|work=udiscovermusic.com|date=January 14, 2020|access-date=January 14, 2020}}</ref>

In early 2022, Moore released two singles from her seventh studio album, ''[[In Real Life (Mandy Moore album)|In Real Life]]''. On March 8, she released the audio for the album's title track, and, on the 17th, a cameo-laden video with many of her ''[[This Is Us]]'' co-stars and [[Matthew Koma]], [[Hilary Duff]], [[Wilmer Valderrama]], [[Amanda Kloots]], [[Karamo Brown]], and others.<ref name="In Real Life">{{Cite magazine |last=Aniftos |first=Rania |date=2022-03-18 |title=Wilmer Valderrama, Hilary Duff & More Stars Appear in Mandy Moore's 'In Real Life' Video |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/mandy-moore-in-real-life-music-video-1235045979/ |access-date=2022-04-05 |magazine=Billboard}}</ref> On April 5, Moore debuted the audio from her second single off the album, "Little Dreams". The album was released on May 13, 2022.<ref name="Little Dreams">{{Cite magazine |last=Paul |first=Larisha |date=2022-04-05 |title=Mandy Moore Romanticizes Mundane Moments on Nostalgic New Single 'Little Dreams' |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/mandy-moore-little-dreams-1332990/ |access-date=2022-04-05 |magazine=Rolling Stone}}</ref>

Moore announced in 2022 that she would be taking a hiatus from acting.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nydailynews.com/snyde/ny-mandy-moore-announces-acting-break-20220523-f5onr465bfh3heaqt6xst6exty-story.html |title=Mandy Moore to take hiatus from acting after 'This Is Us' |publisher=Nydailynews.com |date=2022-05-23 |accessdate=2022-06-13}}</ref>

==Musical style and influences==
[[File:Mandy Moore at the GRAMMY Museum2.jpg|thumb|right|Moore performing at the Grammy Museum on June 11, 2009]]
When Moore's musical career began in 1999, she was known for her [[bubblegum pop]] sound and image, which she revealed was not the type of music she prefers, saying, "[The record company] was like, 'Here are your songs.' I was like, 'Hi, I'm fourteen. I'll do anything.' Those albums are why I'm here today, but god damn, I should give a refund to anyone who bought my first record".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.monkeyouttanowhere.com/quotes/archives/2003/10/17_15_51.html |title=Interview:Mandy Moore explains her pop days |first=Leah |last=Collins |date=January 20, 2010 |access-date=May 31, 2011 |publisher=Dose.ca |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140315041133/http://www.monkeyouttanowhere.com/quotes/archives/2003/10/17_15_51.html |archive-date=March 15, 2014 }}</ref>

Moore has often been praised by music critics for branching off and writing her own music. ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' said, "She has successfully dropped all the tacky accoutrements of her past and turned into a sweet, classy singer-songwriter whose charms are readily apparent".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.allmusic.com/album/amanda-leigh-mw0000816772.html |title=How Mandy Moore has transformed |first=Jocelyn |last=Vena |website=[[AllMusic]] |date=April 28, 2011 |access-date=July 7, 2011 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140905180806/http://www.allmusic.com/album/amanda-leigh-mw0000816772.html |archive-date=September 5, 2014 }}</ref> [[AllMusic]] said, "Moore smoothly evolved from adolescent starlet to mature songwriter, continuing to distance herself from the scene that had launched her career one decade prior".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/mandy-moore-mn0000673933.html |title=Mandy Moore Evolution |first=Jocelyn |last=Vena |website=[[AllMusic]] |date=April 28, 2011 |access-date=July 7, 2011 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140905181301/http://www.allmusic.com/artist/mandy-moore-mn0000673933.html |archive-date=September 5, 2014 }}</ref>

Moore has said that she was inspired by film and television as a child.<ref>{{cite web|title=Mandy Moore little mermaid |url=http://www.spinner.com/2010/12/16/mandy-moore-little-mermaid/ |publisher=Spinner |access-date=December 16, 2010 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110925121821/http://www.spinner.com/2010/12/16/mandy-moore-little-mermaid/ |archive-date=September 25, 2011 }}</ref> She has also said, "I'm stuck in the '70s. I think I'll always have that kind of influence. [[Joni Mitchell]], [[Todd Rundgren]], [[Harry Nilsson]], [[Paul McCartney|McCartney]]—that's the sort of stuff I'm really inspired and influenced by".<ref>{{cite web|title=Mandy Moore working on 70s inspired album |url=http://www.theprophetblog.net/mandy-moore-working-on-70s-inspired-album/ |publisher=Prophet blog |date=Summer 2012 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161116163452/http://www.theprophetblog.net/mandy-moore-working-on-70s-inspired-album/ |archive-date=November 16, 2016 }}</ref> Moore also said how her then-husband, musician [[Ryan Adams]], had a huge influence on her music,<ref>{{cite web|title=Mandy Moore and husband collaboration for new album|url=http://www.sheknows.ca/entertainment/articles/955675/mandy-moore-and-husband-collaboration-for-new-album|publisher=She knows|date=Summer 2012|access-date=March 19, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140905181054/http://www.sheknows.ca/entertainment/articles/955675/mandy-moore-and-husband-collaboration-for-new-album|archive-date=September 5, 2014|url-status=dead}}</ref> and that he introduced her to [[Heavy metal music|heavy metal]]. "Not that I can necessarily differentiate between [[speed metal]] and [[black metal]]…" she said. "I'll tolerate it, but I turn it down".<ref>{{cite web|last=Shapiro |first=David |title=Ryan Adams, Norah Jones and an $80,000 Stereo System |url=https://online.wsj.com/articles/ryan-adams-norah-jones-and-chuck-klosterman-and-an-80-000-stereo-system-1403491229 |work=The Wall Street Journal |date=June 26, 2014 |access-date=June 30, 2014 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140626032234/http://online.wsj.com/articles/ryan-adams-norah-jones-and-chuck-klosterman-and-an-80-000-stereo-system-1403491229 |archive-date=June 26, 2014 }}</ref> Moore has said that she has become more comfortable with her older music, and she even found new ways to present her more bubblegum-friendly songs with a more contemporary musical arrangement.

==Other endeavors==

===Fashion===

Moore's fashion career began in 2005 with her own fashion line called ''Mblem.'' That was a brand of contemporary knitwear and cashmere. One of her focuses was to sell clothing for taller women; Moore herself is {{convert|5|ft|10|in|m}}.<ref>{{cite web|title=Mandy Moore creates 'casual, sexy' T-shirts |publisher=Today.com |url=https://www.today.com/popculture/mandy-moore-creates-casual-sexy-t-shirts-wbna6941196 |access-date=February 5, 2009 }}</ref> In February 2009, Moore announced that the line would be discontinued, but that she hoped to return to her fashion career under different circumstances in the future.<ref name="peoplestylewatch1">{{cite web |url=http://stylenews.peoplestylewatch.com/2009/02/10/mandy-moore-shuts-down-her-clothing-line-mblem/ |title=Mandy Moore Shuts Down Her Clothing Line |work=People |date=February 10, 2009 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090213065051/http://stylenews.peoplestylewatch.com/2009/02/10/mandy-moore-shuts-down-her-clothing-line-mblem/ |archive-date=February 13, 2009 |access-date=February 10, 2009 }}</ref>

===Politics===
In July 2016, Moore appeared on an [[a cappella]] version of [[Rachel Platten]]'s song "[[Fight Song (Rachel Platten song)|Fight Song]]" along with several other celebrities for the [[2016 Democratic National Convention]]<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/onpolitics/2016/07/27/best-celebrity-moments-democratic-national-convention-night-2-meryl-streep-america-ferrera-lena-dunham/87601130/ |title=The Best Celebrity Moments of the Democratic Convention Night 2 |author=McDermott, Maeve |website=[[USA Today]] |date=July 27, 2016 |access-date=July 27, 2016 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160730172413/http://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/onpolitics/2016/07/27/best-celebrity-moments-democratic-national-convention-night-2-meryl-streep-america-ferrera-lena-dunham/87601130/ |archive-date=July 30, 2016 }}</ref> for [[Hillary Clinton]]'s unsuccessful second bid at the presidency.<ref>{{cite web |first=Nicole |last=Bitette |title=SEE IT: Mandy Moore, Elizabeth Banks and countless celebrities create 'Fight Song' video to support Hillary Clinton |url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/music/celebrities-team-fight-song-support-hillary-clinton-article-1.2727985 |work=[[New York Daily News]] |date=July 27, 2016 |access-date=January 6, 2021 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170131204704/http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/music/celebrities-team-fight-song-support-hillary-clinton-article-1.2727985 |archive-date=January 31, 2017 }}</ref>

Moore was one of the demonstrators at the Los Angeles [[2017 Women's March]] held on January 21, 2017.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Friedman |first1=Megan |last2=Matthews |first2=Lyndsey |title=Celebrities Hit the Streets for Women's Marches Around the World |url=http://www.elle.com/culture/career-politics/news/g29350/womens-march-washington-celebrities/ |access-date=January 29, 2017 |work=[[Elle (magazine)|Elle]] |date=January 21, 2017 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170210213807/http://www.elle.com/culture/career-politics/news/g29350/womens-march-washington-celebrities/ |archive-date=February 10, 2017}}</ref>

On January 13, 2020, Moore officially endorsed [[Pete Buttigieg]] for President of the United States prior to the [[2020 Iowa Democratic caucuses|Iowa caucuses]].<ref>{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/politics/8547812/mandy-moore-pete-buttigieg-iowa|title=Mandy Moore to EndorseDemocratic Presidential Hopeful Pete Buttigieg in Iowa|date=January 10, 2020|magazine=Billboard}}</ref> Moore also uses her social media platforms to support [[criminal justice reform]] and [[Black Lives Matter]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://people.com/crime/celebs-react-to-breonna-taylor-indictment-news/|title=Kerry Washington, Oprah Winfrey & More Celebrities React to Breonna Taylor Indictment News|author=Rice, Nicholas|date=24 September 2020|website=people.com|access-date=6 January 2021}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/tv/story/2020-09-24/mandy-moore-announces-she-will-be-a-mom-this-is-us|title=Mandy Moore announces she'll be a mom for real, not just on 'This Is Us'|author=Zornosa, Laura|date=24 September 2020|website=www.latimes.com|access-date=6 January 2021}}</ref>

but in 2019 she called him [[Psychological abuse|emotionally abusive]].<ref name="auto2"/> Court documents obtained later revealed that they had been legally separated for nearly six months before the filing.<ref>{{cite web |last=Saclao |first=Christian |title=Mandy Moore, Estranged Husband Ryan Adams Had Been Legally Separated For Five Months Before Announcing Their Split |url=http://www.designntrend.com/articles/37322/20150129/mandy-moore-estranged-husband-ryan-adams-legally-separated-five-months-before-announcing-their-split.htm |work=Design&Trend |date=January 29, 2015 |access-date=February 11, 2015 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150211000037/http://www.designntrend.com/articles/37322/20150129/mandy-moore-estranged-husband-ryan-adams-legally-separated-five-months-before-announcing-their-split.htm |archive-date=February 11, 2015 }}</ref> The divorce was finalized in June 2016.<ref>{{cite news |title=Mandy Moore and Ryan Adams finalise divorce |url=http://www.new-magazine.co.uk/news/view/81245/Mandy-Moore-and-Ryan-Adams-finalise-divorce/ |date=June 23, 2016 |work=New! Magazine |access-date=June 24, 2016 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160804162319/http://www.new-magazine.co.uk/news/view/81245/Mandy-Moore-and-Ryan-Adams-finalise-divorce |archive-date=August 4, 2016 }}</ref>

In 2015, Moore began dating [[Dawes (band)|Dawes]] frontman [[Taylor Goldsmith]]. They were engaged in September 2017<ref>{{cite news|title=Mandy Moore Celebrates Engagement Party -- See the Pics!|url=http://www.etonline.com/mandy-moore-celebrates-engagement-party-see-pics-87932|work=[[Entertainment Tonight]]|date=September 23, 2017|access-date=September 23, 2017}}</ref> and married on November 18, 2018, in [[Los Angeles]], California.<ref>{{cite news|last=Vulpo|first=Mike|title=Inside Mandy Moore's Private Wedding to Musician Taylor Goldsmith|url=https://www.eonline.com/news/932541/inside-mandy-moore-s-private-wedding-ceremony-to-musician-taylor-goldsmith|work=[[E! News]]|access-date=November 19, 2018|date=November 18, 2018}}</ref> In February 2021, Moore gave birth to the couple's first child, a boy.<ref>{{Cite magazine|first=Rania|last=Aniftos|date=September 24, 2020|title=Mandy Moore Is Pregnant With Her First Child|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/9454891/mandy-moore-is-pregnant-with-her-first-child|access-date=September 24, 2020|magazine=Billboard}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Garvey |first=Marianne |date=February 23, 2021 |title=Mandy Moore welcomes baby boy |url=https://www.cnn.com/2021/02/23/entertainment/mandy-moore-baby/index.html |access-date=February 23, 2021 |website=[[CNN]] |publisher=[[WarnerMedia]] |location=United States}}</ref>

In 2018, Moore appeared on the eleventh season of ''[[Who Do You Think You Are? (U.S. TV series)|Who Do You Think You Are?]]'', during which historian [[Turtle Bunbury]] revealed how her great-great-great-great-grandmother Mary Flynn had died at the age of 40 in an Irish [[workhouse]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Kelly|first=Aoife|title=Mandy Moore reduced to tears over Irish ancestor who died in workhouse during Famine on Who Do You Think You Are|url=https://www.independent.ie/au/entertainment/television/tv-news/mandy-moore-reduced-to-tears-over-irish-ancestor-who-died-in-workhouse-during-famine-on-who-do-you-think-you-are-37597076.html|work=[[Irish Independent]]|date=December 5, 2018|access-date=June 21, 2018}}</ref>

In 2019, Moore, accompanied by friends and fellow hikers reached the [[Everest base camps|Everest base camp]] which has an elevation of 17,598 ft.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.cnn.com/2019/05/29/entertainment/mandy-moore-mount-everest/index.html|title=Mandy Moore celebrates reaching Mount Everest base camp|first=Lisa|last=Respers France|website=CNN|date=May 29, 2019|access-date=May 29, 2019}}</ref>

In June 2022, Moore announced that she is expecting her second son with Goldsmith.<ref>{{cite magazine |last=Chan |first=Anna|date=June 3, 2022 |title=Mandy Moore Is Pregnant, Expecting Baby No. 2 With Taylor Goldsmith |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/mandy-moore-pregnant-second-child-taylor-goldsmith-1235081118/ |access-date=June 3, 2022 |magazine=Billboard}}</ref>

Moore has been diagnosed with [[immune thrombocytopenic purpura]], an [[autoimmune disease]] that causes abnormally low levels of [[platelet]]s.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.medpagetoday.com/popmedicine/celebritydiagnosis/100151|title=Mandy Moore's Immune Thrombocytopenic Purpura|date=August 10, 2022|website=www.medpagetoday.com}}</ref>

==Awards and honors==
{{main|List of awards and nominations received by Mandy Moore}}

In 2012, Moore was ranked number 96 on [[VH1]]'s list of "100 Greatest Women in Music" as well as number 63 on their "Sexiest Artists of All Time List".<ref>{{cite web|last=Graham |first=Mark |url=http://www.vh1.com/music/tuner/2012-02-13/vh1s-100-greatest-women-in-music-complete-list/ |title=The 100 Greatest Women in Music |publisher=VH1 |date=February 13, 2012 |access-date=July 2, 2013 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120304141551/http://www.vh1.com/music/tuner/2012-02-13/vh1s-100-greatest-women-in-music-complete-list/ |archive-date=March 4, 2012 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Viera |first=Bené |url=http://www.vh1.com/music/tuner/2013-03-05/vh1-100-sexiest-artists-complete-list/39/ |title=VH1′s 100 Sexiest Artists [Complete List] |publisher=VH1 |date=March 5, 2013 |access-date=July 2, 2013 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130528160457/http://www.vh1.com/music/tuner/2013-03-05/vh1-100-sexiest-artists-complete-list/39 |archive-date=May 28, 2013 }}</ref>

She was nominated for a [[Golden Globe Award for Best Supporting Actress – Series, Miniseries or Television Film]] and a [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actress in a Drama Series]]. As a part of the ensemble cast of ''This Is Us'', she received two [[Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Drama Series|Screen Actors Guild Awards for Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Drama Series]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Huver|first=Scott|date=2018-01-22|title=What Sterling K. Brown Says About the This Is Us Cast Will Make You Cry|url=https://www.elle.com/culture/movies-tv/a15840331/this-is-us-cast-sterling-k-brown-sag-awards-interview/|access-date=2021-01-28|website=ELLE|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Bricker|first=Tierney|date=January 27, 2019|title=Three Cheers for the Big Three! This Is Us Wins Best Drama Ensemble at the 2019 SAG Awards|url=https://www.eonline.com/news/1008380/three-cheers-for-the-big-three-this-is-us-wins-best-drama-ensemble-at-the-2019-sag-awards|access-date=2021-01-28|website=E! Online}}</ref>

On March 25, 2019, she received a star on the [[Hollywood Walk of Fame]].<ref name="ReferenceB"/><ref name="independent.ie"/><ref name="nbclosangeles.com"/>
